page.title: 06Quarryhead Wood and Oldstone
page.content: Most of{Quarryhead wood}is Ash,Sycamore and beech.As we came down the path we caught a glimpse of the three{lakes.} We found an old{boat house.}One of the lakes has a{legend}that says that a lady drowned her self because her sweetheart could not marry her. {Oldstone Manor}was{burnt down}in 1892,the year of the Great Blizzard.It is a{ruin}you can still see the {hermit's cave}and the{tunnel}which the hermit went through and it came out next to the manor. He came to a ledge where they left his dinner.Down on the lakes they kept three swans. They used the lakes for fetes and on the way to the farm we went along a grass road which used to be lined with trees.Oldstone{Farmhouse}was mentioned in the{original Domesday Book}and belonged to the monks of{Torre Abbey.}
